voice_instruct: Woman, mid-30s, rich contralto with razor precision. Beth Gibbons' smoky vulnerability meets the intellectual authority of a tenured professor. Every word measured, every phrase deliberate. Capable of baroque ornamentation in vocal runs that resolve into trip-hop cool. Voice drips with intelligence and barely concealed danger. Unhurried, devastating.

tracks.title: Heretic's Theorem
tracks.prompt: baroque pop trip-hop fusion, verse: harpsichord arpeggios over Portishead-style heavy trip-hop beat with vinyl crackle, 80 BPM slow and menacing, female contralto vocal cool and intellectual, cello counterpoint weaving baroque lines beneath, chorus: full baroque string arrangement with trip-hop bass drops and scratched turntable textures, elegant and threatening
tracks.lyrics:
[verse 1]
Let me present my theorem, gentlemen,
Deconstructing your theology again,
The Almighty is dead, that's proposition one,
Your faith is architecture without foundation,
I've read your texts in their original tongue,
Cross-referenced every sermon ever sung,
And the evidence, I'm sorry to report,
Makes your entire religion fall short,

[chorus]
Heresy is just the truth
Arriving early to the room,
Heresy is just the proof
That comfortable men consume too soon,
Call me heretic, call me profane,
I call it scholarship, call it my domain,

[verse 2]
The Vorin church constructed careful walls
Of ignorance disguised as protocol,
Women read, men fight, a tidy split
That keeps the powerful exactly where they sit,
But power, gentlemen, is not a throne,
It's information, and I hold my own,
Baroque precision in my argument,
Trip-hop menace in my instrument,

[chorus]
Heresy is just the truth
Arriving early to the room,
Heresy is just the proof
That comfortable men consume too soon,
Call me heretic, call me queen,
I am both, I am the space between,

[bridge - harpsichord solo over trip-hop beat]
Evidence, evidence, evidence,
Reason against the reverence,
Evidence, evidence, evidence,
Truth doesn't care about your preference,

[outro]
I am Jasnah Kholin,
And I have never been wrong about this

tracks.title: Elsecaller
tracks.prompt: baroque pop trip-hop fusion, otherworldly and powerful: Shadesmar represented by reversed orchestral samples and deep sub-bass, harpsichord runs through heavy delay and reverb, 85 BPM with swing feel, female vocal layered in baroque canon with herself, trip-hop drums heavy and deliberate, the sound of stepping between realms
tracks.lyrics:
[verse 1]
I step between the realms like changing rooms,
Shadesmar's ocean, beads of thought and ruin,
The cognitive mirrors the physical,
And I move through both, methodical,
Elsecaller, the order of the mind,
Inkspren bonded to the most refined
Scholar-warrior this world has seen,
Ivory says I'm the best he's been,

[chorus]
Elsecaller, between the worlds I stride,
Baroque fugue on the other side,
Elsecaller, reality bends to thought,
Every truth is dearly bought,
Step through, step through, the veil is thin,
For those with intellect to look within,

[verse 2]
In Shadesmar the spren have cities tall,
Logic given form, ideas given wall,
I catalog the Cosmere's hidden laws,
Because knowledge is the greatest cause,
They fear what I might learn and share,
The powerful always fear the scholars there,
But I will not be silenced, not be still,
The Elsecaller bends the world to will,

[chorus]
Elsecaller, between the worlds I stride,
Baroque fugue on the other side,
Elsecaller, reality bends to thought,
Every truth is dearly bought,
Step through, step through, the veil is thin,
For those with intellect to look within,

[bridge]
Transformation, transportation,
Soulcasting reality's foundation,
I am the woman who remakes the stone,
Philosophy made flesh and bone,

[outro]
The truth is a doorway,
And I have the key

tracks.title: The Alleyway
tracks.prompt: baroque pop trip-hop fusion, dark and violent: heavy Portishead bass with harpsichord stabs played staccato like knife strikes, 75 BPM slow and predatory, female vocal cold and matter-of-fact over the kills then building emotional complexity, minor key baroque string tremolo, trip-hop beat stops dead for moments of violence then resumes
tracks.lyrics:
[verse 1]
Four men in an alley, me in the dark,
They followed the woman, I followed the arc
Of probability, of criminal intent,
I knew what they wanted, I knew what it meant,
So I Soulcast the first one before he could speak,
Turned flesh to fire, stone to smoke in a heartbeat,
Shallan watched in horror, but I watched in math,
Four threats eliminated from the path,

[chorus]
Was it murder? Was it justice?
The philosophers can discuss this,
I weighed the lives, I did the calculation,
Four predators removed from the equation,
Call it cold, call it cruel,
I call it applied philosophy's tool,

[verse 2]
Renarin asked me if I feel remorse,
I feel the weight of every course
Of action taken, action not,
The trolley problem, except I'm not
A student in a lecture hall debate,
I am the woman at the lever of fate,
And I will pull it every single time
If the numbers say the pull saves lives,

[chorus]
Was it murder? Was it justice?
The philosophers can discuss this,
I weighed the lives, I did the calculation,
Utilitarian determination,
Call it cold, call it queen,
I am the sharpest mind they've ever seen,

[bridge - cello solo over trip-hop]
The burden of intelligence
Is knowing what the cost will be
Before you pay it,
And paying it anyway,

[outro]
Four men in an alley,
One woman in the dark,
The math was never wrong,
The mercy was the hardest part

tracks.title: Queen of Alethi
tracks.prompt: baroque pop trip-hop fusion, regal and commanding: full baroque orchestra with period instruments meeting modern trip-hop production, 90 BPM with martial precision, harpsichord and orchestral brass fanfare over heavy breakbeat, female vocal commanding and political, Vivaldi's aggression meets Tricky's paranoia
tracks.lyrics:
[verse 1]
They put a crown on the heretic's head,
The woman they wished was silent or dead,
Queen of Alethi by necessity,
Not by desire but by capacity,
Uncle Dalinar holds the coalition,
I hold the intellectual ammunition,
Every treaty is a theorem proved,
Every alliance a variable moved,

[chorus]
Queen of nothing I ever wanted,
Queen of everything they've always haunted,
Baroque precision in my legislation,
Trip-hop darkness in my reputation,
Bow, bow, bow to the evidence,
Bow to the queen of consequence,

[verse 2]
Wit says I'm the most dangerous woman alive,
That's not flattery, that's the archive
Of every battle fought with words and will,
Every enemy I outmaneuvered still,
The Ghostbloods want what I protect,
The Diagram predicted incorrect,
Because you cannot calculate a mind
That's always seventeen moves behind
The game you think you're playing, dear,
Checkmate was decided years from here,

[chorus]
Queen of nothing I ever wanted,
Queen of everything they've always haunted,
Baroque precision in my legislation,
Trip-hop darkness in my reputation,
Bow, bow, bow to the evidence,
Bow to the queen of consequence,

[bridge]
I didn't want the throne,
I wanted the library,
But when the world burns down,
Scholars become military,

[outro]
Queen of Alethi, heretic divine,
The crown fits the head with the sharpest mind

tracks.title: Ivory Tower
tracks.prompt: baroque pop trip-hop fusion, intimate and resolved: stripped back to harpsichord and trip-hop bass with gentle brush drums, 78 BPM tender and reflective, female vocal showing rare vulnerability, baroque counterpoint between voice and solo cello like a conversation, Beth Gibbons at her most exposed over Handel's tenderness, earned emotional release
tracks.lyrics:
[verse 1]
Ivory is my spren, logic given form,
An inkspren in a world that fears the storm
Of ideas too large for small minds,
He chose me, or perhaps he chose what finds
Its way to those who need a friend
Who'll never lie, who'll never bend
The truth to make it comfortable,
Just like me, he's beautiful
In his refusal to be less
Than absolutely rigorous,

[chorus]
In my ivory tower, I am not alone,
In my ivory tower, I have always known
That solitude is not the same as lonely,
That precision is its own form of homely,
Ivory, Ivory, my constant friend,
Logic and love, they're not at odds in the end,

[verse 2]
They think I cannot love because I think,
As if the heart and mind aren't linked,
I loved a woman once in Kharbranth,
I love Wit now, his strange romance
Of words and wisdom, jest and truth,
Intelligence is not aloof,
It's the deepest kind of caring,
Every calculation, every bearing,
Pointed at protecting those I love,
The math of mercy from above,

[chorus]
In my ivory tower, I am not alone,
In my ivory tower, I have always known
That solitude is not the same as lonely,
That precision is its own form of homely,
Ivory, Ivory, my constant friend,
Logic and love, they're not at odds in the end,

[bridge]
Let them call me cold,
Let them call me stone,
The harpsichord still plays
When no one else is home,

[outro]
And in the quiet of my tower,
I am the woman, not the power,
Jasnah, only Jasnah,
Finally enough
